intro: Agave caribaea, commonly known as the Cuban agave, is a perennial plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are thick and succulent. The plant produces a tall flowering stalk that bears numerous white or pale green flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Its leaves are used in traditional practices and for making beverages, such as the popular aguamiel.
